properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 1:38AM MST until February 13 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
...SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW EXPECTED TODAY...

.Another clipper system is moving through the Northern Plains this
morning, bringing snow and some blowing snow to the region.
Breezy northwesterly winds have resulted in some upslope snow this
morning. Periods of light to moderate snow with areas of blowing
snow will continue through the day today, then diminish by late
afternoon into early evening.

* WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as
25 below zero.

* WHERE...Tripp County.

* WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed
skin in as little as 30 minutes.
properties.instruction:
A wind chill advisory means the combination of wind and cold
temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. If
you go outside, cover all parts of your body, especially your
head, face, and hands.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST THURSDAY
